visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts column chart that visualizes the layers of Earth's atmosphere. The chart should have a title 'Earth's atmosphere' and a subtitle with a link to a NASA source. The x-axis should be hidden, and the y-axis should also be hidden but should have a minimum value of 0. The chart should use a stacking mode of 'percent' for the columns, with a black border and white color for the columns. Each column should have data labels enabled, displaying the series name and a custom height attribute. The tooltip should display custom information about each layer. The legend should be disabled. The chart should include six series representing different layers of the atmosphere: Exosphere, Ionosphere, Thermosphere, Mesosphere, Stratosphere, and Troposphere, each with custom height and info attributes.

custom.info:
This is the upper limit of our atmosphere.
It extends from the top of the thermosphere up to 10,000 km (6,200 mi).

The ionosphere is an abundant layer of electrons and ionized atoms and molecules
that stretches from about 48 kilometers (30 miles) above
the surface to the edge of space at about 965 km (600 mi)

The thermosphere starts just above the mesosphere
and extends to 600 kilometers (372 miles) high

The mesosphere starts just above the stratosphere
and extends to 85 kilometers (53 miles) high

The stratosphere starts just above the troposphere
and extends to 50 kilometers (31 miles) high

The troposphere starts at the Earth's surface
and extends 8 to 14.5 kilometers high (5 to 9 miles)
